title.narrative: Local Economic Development Novo Brdo – LED NB

description.narrative:
Existing and potential/start-up SMEs, as the carriers of economic development in their areas Minority communities while direct approaches will be made to minority groups, women and youth groups in targeted regions so the maximum awareness of activities and maximum participation is ensured
The whole population of targeted region would benefit from strong economy of minority areas, as they will eventually have to get involved into economic flows outside their communities, especially with growth of their businesses

Project outputs: Promotional campaign on program details launched programme through printed material, radio adds, tv commercial, etc Entrepreneurship Introduction training organized in 4 municipalities Organized training on basic accounting and finance issues for local potential and existing entrepreneurs in 4 municipalities Organized training on marketing issues in 4 municipalities Organized business plan writing trainings in 4 municipalities Organized specialized training on agricultural production in 4 municipalities Organized participations of Project beneficiaries on BPC under SPARK Guarantee fund. Organized SME Management training for existing business in 4 municipalities Organized specialized consulting services for most promising business
Output indicators: Population of targeted municipalities informed about the project 60 potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 60 potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 60 potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 60 potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 60 potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 30 business plans approved by jury 30 existing entrepreneurs certified 10 beneficiaries supported
Project outcomes: Increased opportunity for developing new and expanding existing business Through supported SMEs open possibility for increasing job position and employing new workers Successful matchmakings of supported beneficiaries
Outcome indicators: 10 SMEs started or grown 15 new job created 5 matchmaking accomplished

The goal of this Project Proposal is to create favorable economic environment for development and support for businesses in municipalities Gračanica, Ranilug, Gnjilane and Novo Brdo, where the estimated population is some 60,000, with majority (80%) of ethnic Serbs. This kind of projects is currently one of best opportunities for employment of young unemployed people that would, through a program of trainings and minimal financial support, enable them to be competitive at the local level where their businesses and shops are located. Also, this would help them keep their incomes and existence at minimal acceptable level. One of positive reasons for pushing this idea is the fact that minorities have weaker access to labor market, and the project would enable them to get various skills regarding leadership and entrepreneurship through various programs and trainings. This would also mean support for women entrepreneurs. It is obvious that after 1999 there is lack of freedom of movement in these communities, so there is permanent need for Support to SMEs in said communities. This Project Proposal is based on the fact that it proved very successful within the EURED 1 Project funded by EU and YED Project in 2013, funded by Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and implemented in cooperation with BSC Štrpce, so we can say that these project achieved some of best results, and serve as a model and benchmark for other people. This project is intended to support start-ups and new businesses in these communities in eastern and central Kosovo, with the focus on provision of higher education, along with learning of entrepreneurial and innovative skills, as well as certain support in getting information on quality of market researches, and all with the aim of spreading the entrepreneurial spirit and
